MPC

Class MPCScanner

  • java.lang.Object
    • MPC.MPCScanner
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java_cup.runtime.Scanner

    public class MPCScanner
extends java.lang.Object
implements java_cup.runtime.Scanner
    Scans an input character stream into Pascal tokens. Its primary external interface consists of its constructor and the next_token() method (expected by the java_cup Parser). We implement it on top of ScanInStream, which adds line/column position information to an ordinary Java InputStream.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private static class  MPCScanner.Accept
      codes for accepting states, one for each kind of token initially scanned (an ID may turn out to be a keyword)
      private static class  MPCScanner.Action
      codes for actions that can happen at transitions
      private static class  MPCScanner.CharClass
      Character classes, i.e., equivalence classes of input letters
      private static class  MPCScanner.ClassRange
      Really just a record/struct, indicating that a range of character values (from lo through hi, inclusive) belong to the indicated character class (and are treated equivalently for purposes of scanning).
      private static class  MPCScanner.State
      the scanner is written as a finite state machine; this nested (but not "inner") class defines the information we associate with each state
      private static class  MPCScanner.Transition
      Represents a transition to a new State, with a sequence of Actions to take

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int base
      The current number base (10 to 36)
      private static MPCScanner.ClassRange[] classRanges
      data used for initializing classTable

      table that maps input characters to their classes
      private int currHash
      The current hash value

      The current integer value
      private java.io.PrintStream errStr
      A PrintStream on which we can emit any error messages
      private ScanInStream scanStr
      The ScanInStream that we are scanning
      private java.lang.StringBuffer tokBuf
      A buffer in which we accumulate characters for the current token
      private java.io.PrintStream tokStr
      A PrintStream to which we log all tokens created (but if tokstr is null, we silently omit such logging)

                  java.io.PrintStream errStream)
        Builds a new scanner object given input, token output, and error output streams.
        Parameters:

        tokStream - stream on which to log created tokens (null means don't log)
        errStream - stream for any error messages

      • initClassTable

        private static void initClassTable()
        routine to initialize the characters class table given the data immediately above here

      • initStates

        private static void initStates()
        This static initializer sets up the State transitions, after the above enums are initialized.

      • reset

        private void reset()
        This clears the token buffer and alerts our ScanInStream that we are looking for a new token. We should call it right before starting to scan each token.

      • append

        private void append(short newChar)
        Adds an input character to the token buffer, first insuring that the buffer can hold it (i.e., by growing the buffer if need be).
        Parameters:
        newChar - the character (as a Java short) that we wish to add

      • next_token

        public java_cup.runtime.Symbol next_token()
        Method that does the actual work of running the state machine to scan a token; its name and interface are specified by java_cup.
        Specified by:
        next_token in interface java_cup.runtime.Scanner

      • markError

        Parameters:

        See Also:
        markError(int, String)

      • markError

        public void markError(int col,
                      java.lang.String more)
        Marks a scanning error in the current input line, given a column position and an extra message. Does this to the error stream output, and marks by writing dashes and then a caret in the position being marked. The first column is number 1.
        Parameters:
        col - the column number to mark
        more - the additional String message to print
